It later dawns on him the pitch has a greater purpose - to give people who have sacrificed important parts of their lives a second chance. Fantasy, starring Kevin Costner, Ray Liotta, Burt Lancaster and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson in her final film.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: Birdy
programme.desc: A young soldier devastated by his nightmarish experiences in the Vietnam War is committed to an Army mental hospital. He comes to believe he is a bird, and dreams of taking his fantasy to the logical, ultimate conclusion - by learning to fly. Alan Parker's psychological drama, based on William Wharton's novel, with Matthew Modine, Nicolas Cage, John Harkins, Karen Young and Sandy Baron.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
programme.desc: An aspiring writer falls for a seemingly happy-go-lucky woman living in the same apartment building, and is drawn to her unconventional lifestyle. However, he detects her quirky demeanour is masking a colourful past, while her mysterious visits to an imprisoned gangster have unexpected consequences. Romantic comedy drama based on Truman Capote's novel, with Audrey Hepburn, George Peppard, Mickey Rooney and Martin Balsam.(n)

programme.title: The Integrity Of Joseph Chambers
programme.desc: An insurance salesman, hoping to prove his survivalist skills to his family, irresponsibly goes hunting alone. But he isn't prepared for what lies ahead. Writer/director Robert Machoian's drama, starring Clayne Crawford and Jordana Brewster.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor, who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, Paul Reiser and an Oscar-winning JK Simmons.

programme.title: The Man with the Answers
programme.desc: A former diving champion and an eccentric student take an adventurous road trip of rediscovery. Romantic drama, starring Vasilis Magouliotis, Anton Weil and Stella Fyrogeni. In Greek, Italian, German and English.

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: Celebrated British dressmaker Reynolds Woodcock falls in love with Alma, a shy but strong-willed waitress who refuses to conform to his meticulous way of living. Paul Thomas Anderson's Oscar-winning drama, starring Daniel Day-Lewis in his final role before retirement, alongside Vicky Krieps and Lesley Manville.

programme.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
programme.desc: An aspiring writer falls for a seemingly happy-go-lucky woman living in the same apartment building, and is drawn to her unconventional lifestyle. However, he detects her quirky demeanour is masking a colourful past, while her mysterious visits to an imprisoned gangster have unexpected consequences. Romantic comedy drama based on Truman Capote's novel, with Audrey Hepburn, George Peppard, Mickey Rooney and Martin Balsam.

programme.title: And Justice for All
programme.desc: A crusading but struggling lawyer reluctantly defends a cold-hearted judge charged with rape. Already haunted by the fates of two previous clients, he becomes increasingly disillusioned with American legal procedure as the trial progresses. Courtroom drama, starring Al Pacino, Jack Warden, John Forsythe and Lee Strasberg.

programme.title: The Great Escaper

Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: In 1976, Jamaica is dangerously divided across political lines and musician Bob Marley vows to quell the violence by performing at the Smile Jamaica Concert. Two days before the high-profile gig, gunmen break into the singer's home, shooting Bob, his wife Rita and manager Don Taylor. Everyone survives and Marley moves to London with his entourage to begin work on the LP Exodus under Island Records supremo Chris Blackwell. Biographical drama, starring Kingsley Ben-Adir, Lashana Lynch and James Norton.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor, who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, Paul Reiser and an Oscar-winning JK Simmons.

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: Celebrated British dressmaker Reynolds Woodcock falls in love with Alma, a shy but strong-willed waitress who refuses to conform to his meticulous way of living. Paul Thomas Anderson's Oscar-winning drama, starring Daniel Day-Lewis in his final role before retirement, alongside Vicky Krieps and Lesley Manville.

programme.title: And Justice for All

Already haunted by the fates of two previous clients, he becomes increasingly disillusioned with American legal procedure as the trial progresses. Courtroom drama, starring Al Pacino, Jack Warden, John Forsythe and Lee Strasberg.

programme.title: Calvary
programme.desc: A priest in a rural Irish village receives a confession from a man who vows to kill him in one week as punishment for the Catholic Church's history of child abuse. The cleric spends his last seven days trying to put his community's affairs in order, but finds himself surrounded by people who harbour resentments of their own against the Church. Drama, starring Brendan Gleeson, Chris O'Dowd, Kelly Reilly, Aidan Gillen and Dylan Moran.

programme.title: High Noon
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef.

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: In October 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir initially refuses to act on intelligence that suggests Egypt and Syria intend to launch a co-ordinated military offensive against Israel. Eventually the attacks begin, catching Minister of Defence Moshe Dayan off guard. Meir refuses to accept his resignation and a weakened Dayan leads the Israeli response, which requires Meir to request air support from US Secretary of State, Henry Kissinger. Biopic, starring Helen Mirren, Zed Josef and Liev Schreiber.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: A US congressman gets embroiled in a secret mission to provide covert military support to rebels in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan. Before long, he finds unlikely allies in the shape of a womanising CIA agent, a Texan socialite and the president of Pakistan. Fact-based political drama set during the 1980s, starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: American fashion model-turned-war photographer Lee Miller is determined to document the truth of the Nazi regime, and in spite of the odds stacked against female correspondents, she captures some of the most important images of the Second World War. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Winslet, Andy Samberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Marion Cotillard.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: In the months leading up to the Second World War, a young London stockbroker attempts to rescue hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia. Fifty years later he comes to terms with the guilt and grief he carried with him for decades. Drama based on a true story, starring Anthony Hopkins, Lena Olin and Johnny Flynn.

programme.title: Calvary
programme.desc: A priest in a rural Irish village receives a confession from a man who vows to kill him in one week as punishment for the Catholic Church's history of child abuse. Drama, starring Brendan Gleeson, Chris O'Dowd, Kelly Reilly, Aidan Gillen and Dylan Moran.

Biopic, starring Helen Mirren, Zed Josef and Liev Schreiber.

programme.title: Monsoon
programme.desc: A British-Vietnamese man returns to his birth country for the first time in more than 30 years. He was only eight when he and his family escaped Saigon as boat refugees during the Vietnam-American war. Now he embarks on a personal journey from Saigon to Hanoi to find a place to scatter his parents' ashes. Drama, starring Henry Golding, Parker Sawyers, David Tran and Molly Harris.(n)

programme.title: Nobody's Fool
programme.desc: Ageing rebel Sully has spent a lifetime avoiding responsibility. When Sully is reunited with his estranged son, he learns he is a grandfather, forcing him to reassess his attitudes and driving him to get to know his family before it is too late. Comedy drama, starring Paul Newman, Dylan Walsh, Bruce Willis and Melanie Griffith.(n)

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: American fashion model-turned-war photographer Lee Miller is determined to document the truth of the Nazi regime, and in spite of the odds stacked against female correspondents, she captures some of the most important images of the Second World War. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Winslet, Andy Samberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Marion Cotillard.(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War

Fifty years later he comes to terms with the guilt and grief he carried with him for decades. Drama based on a true story, starring Anthony Hopkins, Lena Olin and Johnny Flynn.(n)

programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: A youngster must decide between choosing the future his father wants and following his dream of becoming a pro skateboarder. Confronted with the uncertainty of his future - and how it might impact his friends and family - he takes steps to build relationships with professional skaters in an effort to forge his own path. Comedy drama, starring Ryder McLaughlin, Vince Vaughn and Miranda Cosgrove.(n)

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
programme.desc: A shy man struggling to cope with a recent break-up is horrified to learn his impulsive former girlfriend has had all recollection of their relationship erased from her mind. He gets even by having the same treatment, but during the procedure he relives their time together and falls for her again, leaving him determined to keep his memories. Michel Gondry's surreal romantic drama, with Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Tom Wilkinson and Elijah Wood.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.(n)

programme.title: Monsoon
programme.desc: A British-Vietnamese man returns to his birth country for the first time in more than 30 years. He was only eight when he and his family escaped Saigon as boat refugees during the Vietnam-American war. Now he embarks on a personal journey from Saigon to Hanoi to find a place to scatter his parents' ashes. Drama, starring Henry Golding, Parker Sawyers, David Tran and Molly Harris.(n)

programme.title: All That Jazz
programme.desc: A womanising, drug-addled Broadway choreographer begins to crack under the strain of preparing a major show, while being haunted with visions of his impending mortality. Bob Fosse's musical, with Roy Scheider, Jessica Lange, Ann Reinking and Leland Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Sacrifice
programme.desc: American chess prodigy Bobby Fischer challenges the best player in the Soviet Union in a top championship, causing the two nations to use the event to fuel their respective agendas. Fischer soon finds himself caught between the two superpowers as well as having to deal with his own struggles. Tobey Maguire and Liev Schreiber star in this fact-based sporting drama set in 1972 during the Cold War.(n)

programme.title: Nobody's Fool
programme.desc: Ageing rebel Sully has spent a lifetime avoiding responsibility. When Sully is reunited with his estranged son, he learns he is a grandfather, forcing him to reassess his attitudes and driving him to get to know his family before it is too late. Comedy drama, starring Paul Newman, Dylan Walsh, Bruce Willis and Melanie Griffith.(n)

programme.title: Babes
programme.desc: After New York yoga teacher Dawn goes into labour, best friend Eden offers wise-cracking support to herald the safe arrival of a baby girl. Later, Eden falls pregnant after meeting an actor, who subsequently ghosts her. Comedy, co-written by and starring Ilana Glazer, with Michelle Buteau and John Carroll Lynch.(n)

programme.title: My Penguin Friend
programme.desc: A fisherman finds a friend in a lost penguin, and after taking the bird under his wing, he finds a new sense of joy. Director David Schurmann's drama inspired by a true story, starring Jean Reno and Adriana Barraza.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Diabolical nemesis Maxime Le Mal and his femme fatale girlfriend Valentina target Anti-Villain League agent Gru, girlfriend Lucy, their girls Margo, Edith and Agnes and new addition Gru Jr. The family goes on the run while the Minions invade AVL HQ. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.title: Transformers One
programme.desc: Years before the sentient robots became arch enemies, Optimus Prime and Megatron were friends on their home planet of Cybertron. However, their feud changes the universe forever. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Chris Hemsworth, Brian Tyree Henry, Scarlett Johansson and Keegan-Michael Key.(n)

programme.title: Twisters
programme.desc: Meteorologist Kate Cooper crosses paths with social media star Tyler Owens. He recklessly chases storms with his crew and gleefully posts their daredevil exploits, as multiple storm systems converge over central Oklahoma. Standalone disaster sequel, starring Daisy Edgar-Jones and Glen Powell.(n)

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure, the conclusion to Peter Jackson's trilogy, starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Bilbo and his dwarf friends are facing enemies on all sides. They will have to fight orcs, trolls and each other if they are to keep hold of their gold. Meanwhile, Gandalf faces an ancient evil.

programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
programme.desc: The first part of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on the book by JRR Tolkien, starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Encouraged by the wizard Gandalf, Bilbo Baggins leaves the comfort of his home in the Shire to join a band of dwarves in their quest to reclaim the Kingdom of Erebor from the dragon Smaug. It is a journey that will see the plucky hobbit encounter goblins, orcs and

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Bilbo Baggins marches on towards the Lonely Mountain flanked by Thorin and his band of dwarves. There he is destined to encounter the fire-breathing dragon Smaug, guardian of a precious, mystical stone that bestows great power on anyone who possesses it.

programme.desc: Disillusioned in a modern world, a man (Sean Penn) tries to come to terms with the complicated relationship that he shared with his father (Brad Pitt).

programme.desc: Horrific events plague a teen when his parents send him to a Christian camp.

programme.desc: Astronauts (Liev Schreiber, Elias Koteas, Romola Garai) on Mars contend with a microbe that turns those it infects into zombielike killers.

programme.title: Entertainment
programme.desc: An abrasive stand-up comic (Gregg Turkington) hits the road to perform a series of shows at seedy venues.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: After landing US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River, Capt. Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks) faces an investigation that threatens to destroy his career and reputation.

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: A dramatization of the disaster in April 2010, when the offshore drilling rig called the Deepwater Horizon exploded, resulting in the worst oil spill in American history.

programme.title: My Golden Days
programme.desc: A middle-aged anthropologist (Mathieu Amalric) reminisces about family, school adventures, a student trip to the USSR and the love (Lou Roy-Lecollinet) of his life.

programme.title: The Last Circus
programme.desc: A twisted love triangle develops among a Spanish clown (Carlos Areces), his cruel rival (Antonio de la Torre) and the rival's abused -- but lustful -- wife (Carolina Bang).

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: A social misfit (Sissy Spacek) with psychic powers wreaks havoc at her prom to get even with pranksters.

programme.title: The Dark Money Game
programme.desc: Tracing the tangled history of campaign finance back to the creation of the Federal Election Commission (FEC) in 1975, the 2002 McCain-Feingold Campaign Finance Reform Bill, and the Citizens United decision of 2010.
A time traveler risks his life to change the course of history and save the future of humanity.

programme.title: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
programme.desc: A fatherless teen starts to insinuate himself into the life of a renowned surgeon, his wife and two children. The full scope of his intent soon becomes menacingly clear when he confronts the doctor with a long-forgotten transgression.

programme.title: Civil War
programme.desc: In a fractured near-future America balanced on the razor's edge, a group of journalists must race through battlefields to reach the White House before D.C. falls.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: After leaving her all-female island for the first time, Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) discovers her full powers and true destiny while fighting alongside men in a war to end all wars.

programme.title: Watchmen Chapter I
programme.desc: In an alternate world, the murder of a government sponsored superhero draws his outlawed colleagues out of retirement, into a mystery that threatens their lives and the world itself.

programme.title: Friday After Next
programme.desc: Working as security guards, Craig (Ice Cube) and Day-Day (Mike Epps) run into the thief who stole their Christmas presents.

programme.title: Good Hair
programme.desc: Comic Chris Rock explores how hairstyles affect the self-esteem, activities and relationships of African-Americans.

programme.title: Stevie Van Zandt: Disciple
programme.desc: Stevie Van Zandt's life and career as a musician, songwriter, producer, activist, actor, and right-hand man to Bruce Springsteen.

programme.title: Fist Fight
programme.desc: Fired from his teaching job for losing his cool, a disgruntled man (Ice Cube) challenges the colleague (Charlie Day) who snitched on him to a fight after school.

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Outraged citizens try to pull the plug on a staging of a lighthearted musical sequel to Shakespeare's tragedy, which has been written by the high-school drama teacher (Steve Coogan).

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: Jaime Reyes finds himself in possession of an ancient relic of alien biotechnology called the Scarab. When the Scarab chooses Jaime to be its symbiotic host, he's bestowed with a suit of armor that's capable of extraordinary and unpredictable powers.

programme.title: Drinking Buddies
programme.desc: Although they're both dating other people, two co-workers (Olivia Wilde, Jake Johnson) hang out together in bars and try to ignore their mutual attraction.

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: The CIA's most dangerous former operative is drawn out of hiding to uncover more explosive truths about his past.

programme.title: We Live in Time
programme.desc: A surprise encounter brings together a couple, changing the course of their lives. Challenged by the limits of time, they learn to cherish each moment of their decade-spanning and movingly rare love story.

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Two criminals (Billy Bob Thornton, Tony Cox) disguise themselves as St. Nick and an elf to rob stores at Christmastime.

programme.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
programme.desc: A 19th-century martial arts master (Chow Yun-Fat) gives a sword called Green Destiny to his beloved (Michelle Yeoh), then the two must recover it from female thieves.

programme.title: Skin Can Breathe
programme.desc: A gay teen tries to adjust to a new life after moving from Cambodia to America with his mother.

programme.title: Severance
programme.desc: A killer stalks members (Danny Dyer, Laura Harris, Tim McInnerny) of a sales group from an international arms company, who have become lost in the woods during a team-building weekend.

programme.title: Janet Planet
programme.desc: Enthralled by her own imagination, 11-year-old Lacy spends the long summer at home with her mother and three strangers.

programme.title: Life Partners
programme.desc: A 29-year-old lawyer (Gillian Jacobs) and her lesbian best friend (Leighton Meester) experience a dramatic shift in their longtime bond after one enters a serious relationship.

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: Conflicting evidence leads a federal agent (Guy Pearce) to question the motives behind a former Special Ops soldier's (Don Cheadle) apparent ties to terrorist groups.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: Bob the Drag Queen, Eureka O'Hara and Shangela Laquifa Wadley arrive in Gettysburg, Pa., to put on a one-night-only drag show featuring locals in need of a little support and empowerment, including Hunter, Darryl and Erica.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: Bob, Eureka and Shangela head to Twin Falls, Idaho, a conservative, predominantly Mormon community in Magic Valley; the queens meet a group of drag artists who need help forming a community and work with Clifton, Brandon and Mikayla.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: In Branson, Mo., a wholesome showbiz town smack in the middle of the Bible Belt, Bob, Eureka, and Shangela help Tanner, Charles and Chris who are struggling to be their true selves in a community that prides itself on its traditional values.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: The queens help the residents of Farmington and Shiprock, N.M.; they enlist gay Navajo photographer Nate, lesbian public defender Nicole, and Stacey and her daughter, Jasmine, who are processing the suicide of their daughter and sister, DJ.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: Bob, Eureka and Shangela shake things up in Ruston, La.; they enlist Jose, a gay man who is tired of censoring himself, ex-firefighter Stacy, a straight ally, and Lynn, a lesbian who lost her left arm and leg but wants to reclaim her independence.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: COVID-19 disrupts the queens' production schedule, but they make it work; as Bob, Eureka and Shangela explore the series' impact, they reveal the life-changing experiences they've had traveling across the country and meeting LGBTQ community members.

programme.desc: An awkward office drone (Jesse Eisenberg) becomes increasingly unhinged after a charismatic and confident look-alike takes a job at his workplace and seduces the woman (Mia Wasikowska) he desires.
